item.description:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:92, topic:391884”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=489049.msg3793496#msg3793496 date=1319454734]

[/quote]Stuff like this that I love about Firefox
[/quote]Because it isn’t the exact same thing in chrome.
[/quote]There’s a reason chrome copied it[/quote]

The only thing they copied was the shortcut “about:memory” which actually redirects to chrome://memory-redirect/. This memory page existed waaaay before firefox’s…

item.title: @firefox fanboys who refuse to believe this happens
item.dc:creator: @Wizzup Wizzup?
item.description:
@Wizzup wrote:

./mem.py | grep firefox

521.9 MiB + 15.5 MiB = 537.4 MiB firefox

~ 100 tabs open. (not all loaded I presume)

E: Also, I don’t think you guys ever heard of caching? Those tabs are cached. Try pressing the key combo to undo tab close. (It’s ‘u’ for me with pentadactyl)

E2: Also, about:memory

Read full topic

item.source: @firefox fanboys who refuse to believe this happens

item.title: @firefox fanboys who refuse to believe this happens
item.dc:creator: @Unlimited1 .Unlimited
item.description:
@Unlimited1 wrote:

A new version number for a browser release may not be quite as major as it used to be, but Mozilla is promising a few fairly big improvements with the just-released Firefox 7. The biggest of those are all in the performance department, including "significantly" reduced memory usage (up to 50 percent less in some cases), and a new version of the hardware-accelerated Canvas that promises to speed up HTML5 sites. Also making its debut is a new Telemetry feature that lets users anonymously provide browser performance data to Mozilla if they choose to opt-in. Hit the links below for the complete rundown and download link.
http://www.engadget.com/2011/09/27/firefox-7-now-officially-available-promises-significantly-red/
Changelogof Firefox 7:

Drastically improved memory handling for certain use cases
Added a new rendering backend to speed up Canvas operations on Windows systems
Bookmark and password changes now sync almost instantly when using Firefox Sync
The ‘http://’ URL prefix is now hidden by default
Added support for text-overflow: ellipsis
Added support for the Web Timing specification
Enhanced support for MathML
The WebSocket protocol has been updated from version 7 to version 8
Added an opt-in system for users to send performance data back to Mozilla to improve future versions of Firefox
Fixed several stability issues
Fixed several security issues


Let the tests commence!

Read full topic
item.source: @firefox fanboys who refuse to believe this happens
